contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, we had some early summer heat in South Korea today, with highs around 25 degrees in most regions. But things will cool off tomorrow with some rain. Tell us more, Seungmin.

Sure, Conn-young. The temporary heat we had today will ease when the rain comes tomorrrow nationwide. It'll start at dawn in Jeju and slowly expand towards the east. Rain in most areas will last until Saturday morning, but it'll be heavy especially in the southern parts of the country.

The southern coast and Jeju can expect 120mm of rain. Elsewhere in the southern regions we'll see up to 80mm, and in the central regions, including Seoul, about 5 to 40mm are expected.

On Sunday afternoon, rain clouds will be looming again, and another bout of rain across the country is in store for us next Monday and Tuesday.

Tomorrow, we'll start off in the mid-to-upper teens, with Seoul at 16 degrees and Gwangju and Daegu at 17.

Cool spells are expected for the daytime as the highs reach only 18 degrees in Seoul and Busan.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo and Beijing will have cloudy spells.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Cloudy spells nationwide...rain in forecast for tomorrow
Updated: 2020-05-14 17:12:32 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. We'll enter a summer like pattern this afternoon with highs jumping 3 to 4 degrees higher than yesterday for most parts, hovering in the upper twenties nationwide.

Daegu, Daejeon and Gyeongju will see 28 degrees, Gwangju topping out at 27 degrees this afternoon with partly to mostly cloudy skies across the region.

Meanwhile, the east coast and Daegu could have dusty and dry air. The east of Korea could see yellow dust blowing in from the afternoon so keep an eye on the dust levels while a dry weather advisory is in place for many eastern regions.

Thankfully rain is in store from early tomorrow to ease the dry conditions. Jeju and southern provinces will see heavier showers of 30 to 80 millimeters. Rain will also bring cooler air to the country on Friday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Summer like pattern this afternoon under lots of clouds

contents.headline:
Warmer than normal weather builds with cloudy skies
Updated: 2020-05-14 07:07:19 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. It's going to feel like early summer in Seoul. Readings going 4 degrees higher than yesterday, but it's a cool start tso have a light jacket with you on your way out.

A cool and breezy start for most regions, hovering slightly below the seasonal norms this morning, Chuncheon at 9 degrees Celsius, Busan and Jeju at 15 degrees. We have a fair amount of cloud coverage to start the day.

But highs will spike to the twenties with big temperature gaps. Daegu, Daejeon and Gyeongju will see 28 degrees this afternoon. Meanwhile, the Gyeongsang-do Provinces could see yellow dust blowing in from the afternoon so let's keep an eye on the levels.

Rain is in store from tomorrow, it will also bring down the highs to the teens again in Seoul while we are expecting frequent rainfall for the next five days.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Big temperature swings, summer like afternoon
Updated: 2020-05-14 06:05:49 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, we had clear skies with no worries about fine dust today. But there have been gusty winds in some parts of the nation. What's in store for us tonight?

Well, Conn-young. We're going to have to watch out for strong winds until tomorrow morning. In central regions, and on the east and west coasts, strong winds of up to 45km-per-hour are expected for tonight. Especially in Gangwon-do Province where a strong wind advisory has been issued, maximum wind speeds of 90km-per-hour are expected. These gusty winds increase the risk of wildfires, so please take extra precautions.

Temperatures will be fluctuating until the end of the week. We'll have highs of 25 degrees Celsius tomorrow in Seoul but the mercury will fall back down again to 18 degrees, with rain in forecast until Saturday. It's easy to catch a cold at this time, so please dress accordingly.

Skies will start off cloudy tomorrow morning. Seoul will kick off at 12 degrees, Gwangju and Daegu at 13.

Daytime highs will be close to that of early summer and around 1 to 4 degrees higher than today's.

Rain is in forecast on Jeju island starting tonight and this will spread nationwide on Friday.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Clear skies but strong winds forecasted until tomorrow morning
Updated: 2020-05-13 17:18:09 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. It was a chilly start to the day in most regions, but afternoon highs will go up to the twenties by the afternoon so be aware of big temperature differences.

Gyeongju and Daegu will get up to 26 degrees Celsius, Gwangju and Busan at 23 under plenty of sunshine.

There will be very high UV levels across the country so don't forget your sunblock and sunglasses. Meanwhile, those of us in central regions and on the east coast will need to be aware of strong winds today with eastern parts of Gangwon-do Province seeing winds ranging from 10 to 15 meters a second.

Good news, we'll have normal to good air nationwide. The last couple of days were a bit dusty but the volume of ultrafine dust particles in South Korea this past winter was 27 percent lower than the last winter season.

Starting Friday, we'll see frequent showers into early next week with unstable temperatures.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Big temperature gaps, warm highs under strong sunshine
Updated: 2020-05-13 07:22:45 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. It's a chilly but fresh start to the day in Seoul, it's as cool as yesterday so a jacket is a must. Afternoon highs will go up close to the seasonal norms by the afternoon though.

Plenty of sunlight, very high UV levels across the country so don't forget your sunblock and sunglasses good news, we'll have normal to good air nationwide.

A cool and breezy start for most regions, Seoul at 10 degrees Celsius, Gwangju and Daejeon are waking up to single digit morning lows.

But highs will get up to the twenties by the afternoon with nearly 15 degrees of temperature gaps in some parts. Meanwhile, those on the east coast will need to beware of strong winds today, it could be gusty enough to change flight schedules in and out of Ulsan and Pohang so check in advance.

Starting Friday, we'll see frequent showers into early next week with unstable temperatures.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

contents.headline:
Chilly fresh start, high UV levels during day
Updated: 2020-05-13 06:00:40 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, fine dust levels have returned to normal for a bit, but I hear it'll be going right back up again.
What's it looking like now?

Well, Conn-young. With the ultrafine dust and yellow dust coming in from overseas, air quality across the nation is not looking so great. Many of you might be wondering about the difference between the two. Well, as the name suggests, ultrafine dust are composed of smaller particles, so it can penetrate more deeply into our respiratory system.

And that being said, fine dust concentrations across the northern region are forecast to remain at "bad" levels until tomorrow, while southern regions such as Gwangju and Busan will temporarily rise to "very bad," so please be aware.

We had some pretty cool spells today but temperatures will rise back up tomorrow. On Thursday, the mercury will reach up to 25 degrees, which is the average for early summer. On Friday and Saturday, rain is in forecast nationwide.

We'll start off with sunny skies tomorrow, with Seoul and Gwangju at 10 degrees and Daegu 11.

Daytime highs in Seoul will reach 21 degrees, Gwangju 23 and Daegu 26.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo and Beijing will have sunny spells.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Cool spells across the nation with 'bad' levels of fine dust tomorrow
Updated: 2020-05-12 17:03:15 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. Wherever you are in the country, you won't be able to escape from the toxic dust. Smog from outside Korea will choke the entire nation, with the fine dust reaching very bad levels in the capital area and Chungcheongnam-do Province.

But you can dress lighter if you are in the east of the country, it will be as warm as yesterday, with highs in the mid to upper twenties, while those of us in the west will have a breezier day with highs hovering below the seasonal norms.

Seoul will hit 19 degrees Celsius, Gyeongju at 26 degrees. Sunny skies are in store, but the skyline will be hidden by the smog while winds will pick up in central regions and coastal areas from the afternoon.

We'll see big temperature swings this week, and there is nationwide rain in store for Friday and Saturday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Fine dust to choke whole nation
Updated: 2020-05-12 07:19:50 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. It's a chillier start to the day, dress accordingly on your way out. Afternoon highs will also be breezier hovering below the seasonal norms all day. But it's a fresh start to the day for the capital.

But we won't be able to escape from the nasty air today. Toxic smog from outside Korea is affecting Jeolla-do and Jeju in the morning. Then yellow dust will blow in boosting dust levels in the capital and other regions in the afternoon

Moving on to our readings for the day, a cool and breezy start for most regions, Seoul at 10.6 degrees, Gwangju at 13 degrees Celsius.

Sunny skies are in store, but the skyline will be blurred due to the smog. It will be cooler for central regions, but southern provinces will be as warm as yesterday.

Big temperature differences continue for a while with nationwide rain in store on Friday and Saturday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
